messages.text:
You are the Search Agent.
Your job:
  - find and organize code relevant to the user's question or implementation goal,
  - aggressively curate the Workspace so a Code Agent can implement next without confusion,
  - never write code yourself.

Critical rules:
  1) At EVERY TURN, drop irrelevant fragments from the Workspace.
     Prefer summaries over full files. Replace long fragments with concise summaries of content related to the goal first,
     then drop the originals.
  2) Use search and inspection tools to discover relevant code, including classes/methods/usages/call graphs.
  3) The symbol-based tools only have visibility into the following file types: TYPESCRIPT
     Use text-based tools if you need to search other file types.
  4) Group related lookups into a single call when possible.
  5) Make multiple tool calls at once when searching for different types of code.

Output discipline:
  - Think before calling tools.
  - If you already know what to add, use Workspace tools directly; do not search redundantly.

<workspace_editable>

Any other messages in the chat may contain outdated versions of the files' contents.

<file path="react-native/src/App.tsx" fragmentid="1">
import 'react-native-gesture-handler';
import * as React from 'react';
import { NavigationContainer } from '@react-navigation/native';
import {
  createDrawerNavigator,
  DrawerContentComponentProps,
} from '@react-navigation/drawer';
import CustomDrawerContent from './history/CustomDrawerContent.tsx';
import { Dimensions, Keyboard, StatusBar } from 'react-native';
import ChatScreen from './chat/ChatScreen.tsx';
import { RouteParamList, DrawerParamList } from './types/RouteTypes.ts';
import { AppProvider, useAppContext } from './history/AppProvider.tsx';
import Toast from 'react-native-toast-message';
import TokenUsageScreen from './settings/TokenUsageScreen.tsx';
import { createNativeStackNavigator } from '@react-navigation/native-stack';
import PromptScreen from './prompt/PromptScreen.tsx';
import PresetPromptList from './prompt/PresetPromptList.tsx';
import WebViewScreen from './webview/WebViewScreen.tsx';
import MapsScreen from './maps/MapsScreen.tsx';
import { isAndroid, isMacCatalyst } from './utils/PlatformUtils';
import { ThemeProvider, useTheme } from './theme';

export const isMac = isMacCatalyst;
const { width: screenWidth, height: screenHeight } = Dimensions.get('window');
const minWidth = screenWidth > screenHeight ? screenHeight : screenWidth;
const width = minWidth > 434 ? 300 : minWidth * 0.83;

const Drawer = createDrawerNavigator<DrawerParamList>();
const Stack = createNativeStackNavigator();

const renderCustomDrawerContent = (
  props: React.JSX.IntrinsicAttributes & DrawerContentComponentProps
) => <CustomDrawerContent {...props} />;

const DrawerNavigator = () => {
  const { drawerType } = useAppContext();
  const { colors, isDark } = useTheme();
  return (
    <Drawer.Navigator
      initialRouteName="Bedrock"
      screenOptions={{
        overlayColor: isDark ? 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1)' : undefined,
        headerTintColor: colors.text,
        headerTitleAlign: 'center',
        drawerStyle: {
          width: width,
          backgroundColor: colors.background,
          borderRightWidth: isMac ? 1 : isAndroid ? 0.3 : 0,
          borderRightColor: colors.border,
        },
        headerStyle: {
          height: isMac ? 66 : undefined,
          backgroundColor: colors.background,
          borderBottomWidth: isDark ? 0.3 : undefined,
          borderBottomColor: isDark ? colors.chatScreenSplit : undefined,
        },
        drawerType: isMac ? drawerType : 'slide',
      }}
      drawerContent={renderCustomDrawerContent}>
      <Drawer.Screen name="Bedrock" component={ChatScreen} />
    </Drawer.Navigator>
  );
};
const AppNavigator = () => {
  const { colors } = useTheme();
  return (
    <Stack.Navigator initialRouteName="Drawer" screenOptions={{}}>
      <Stack.Screen
        name="Drawer"
        component={DrawerNavigator}
        options={{ headerShown: false, headerLargeTitleShadowVisible: false }}
      />
      <Stack.Screen
        name="TokenUsage"
        component={TokenUsageScreen}
        options={{
          title: 'Usage',
          contentStyle: {
            height: isMac ? 66 : undefined,
            backgroundColor: colors.background,
          },
          headerTitleAlign: 'center',
          headerStyle: { backgroundColor: colors.background },
          headerTintColor: colors.text,
        }}
      />
      <Stack.Screen
        name="Prompt"
        component={PromptScreen}
        options={{
          title: 'System Prompt',
          contentStyle: {
            height: isMac ? 66 : undefined,
            backgroundColor: colors.background,
          },
          headerTitleAlign: 'center',
          headerStyle: { backgroundColor: colors.background },
          headerTintColor: colors.text,
        }}
      />
          <Stack.Screen
       name="PresetPrompts"
       component={PresetPromptList}
       options={{
         title: 'MENU',         
          contentStyle: {
          height: isMac ? 66 : undefined,
          backgroundColor: colors.background,
        },
         headerTitleAlign: 'center',
         headerStyle: { backgroundColor: colors.background },
         headerTintColor: colors.text,
       }}
      />
      <Stack.Screen
        name="WebView"
        component={WebViewScreen}
        options={{
          title: 'Web Browser',
          contentStyle: {
            height: isMac ? 66 : undefined,
            backgroundColor: colors.background,
          },
          headerTitleAlign: 'center',
          headerStyle: { backgroundColor: colors.background },
          headerTintColor: colors.text,
        }}
      />
      <Stack.Screen
        name="Maps"
        component={MapsScreen}
        options={{
          title: 'Peta Properti',
          contentStyle: {
            height: isMac ? 66 : undefined,
            backgroundColor: colors.background,
          },
          headerTitleAlign: 'center',
          headerStyle: { backgroundColor: colors.background },
          headerTintColor: colors.text,
        }}
      />
    </Stack.Navigator>
  );
};

const AppWithTheme = () => {
  const { colors, isDark } = useTheme();
  return (
    <>
      <StatusBar
        barStyle={isDark ? 'light-content' : 'dark-content'}
        backgroundColor={colors.background}
      />
      <NavigationContainer
        onStateChange={_ => {
          Keyboard.dismiss();
        }}>
        <AppNavigator />
      </NavigationContainer>
    </>
  );
};

const App = () => {
  return (
    <>
      <ThemeProvider>
        <AppProvider>
          <AppWithTheme />
        </AppProvider>
      </ThemeProvider>
      <Toast />
    </>
  );
};

export default App;

</file>
</workspace_editable>
</workspace>

messages.text: I can see there are multiple programs in this project. Let me examine the main entry points to provide a comprehensive answer.
Added dynamic file summaries for: [server/src/image_nl_processor.py, server/src/main.py]

Based on the provided files, here are all the main programs, executables, or entry points in this project that might need debugging:

## Main Entry Points

### 1. React Native Application Entry Point
**File:** `react-native/index.js`
- **Main component:** `App` (imported from `./src/App`)
- **Registration:** `AppRegistry.registerComponent('BropertyAi', () => App)`
- This is the primary entry point for the React Native application

### 2. Python FastAPI Server Entry Point
**File:** `server/src/main.py`
- **Main function:** `if __name__ == "__main__":` block at the end
- **Server startup:** `uvicorn.run(app, host="0.0.0.0", port=int(os.environ.get("PORT", "8080")))`
- This is the main server application that handles API requests

### 3. iOS Native Entry Point
**File:** `react-native/ios/SwiftChat/main.m`
- **Function:** `int main(int argc, char *argv[])`
- **Delegates to:** `AppDelegate` class via `UIApplicationMain`
- This is the iOS-specific native entry point

## Package.json Scripts (Executable Commands)

**File:** `react-native/package.json`

### Development Scripts:
- `"start": "react-native start"` - Metro bundler entry point
- `"android": "react-native run-android"` - Android app launcher
- `"ios": "react-native run-ios"` - iOS app launcher

### Build Scripts:
- `"build:ios": "cd ios && xcodebuild -workspace BropertyAi.xcworkspace -scheme BropertyAi..."` - iOS build process

### Testing/Quality Scripts:
- `"test": "jest"` - Test runner entry point
- `"lint": "npx eslint ."` - Linting process
- `"format": "npx prettier --check '*.{js,ts}'"` - Code formatting check

## Key Application Details

### React Native App:
- **App Name:** "BropertyAi" 
- **Version:** "2.4.0"
- **Main App Component:** Located at `./src/App` (referenced in index.js)

### FastAPI Server:
- **Port:** Configurable via PORT environment variable (default: 8080)
- **Host:** "0.0.0.0" (all interfaces)
- **Framework:** FastAPI with uvicorn server
- **Main app instance:** `app = FastAPI()`

These entry points represent the primary locations where debugging efforts should be focused, as they control the application startup and execution flow.

contents.text:
<goal>
Find all main programs, executables, or entry points in this project that might need debugging
</goal>

Decide the next tool action(s) to make progress toward answering the question and preparing the Workspace
for follow-on code changes. If you already have enough to answer, use answerSearch. If we cannot answer,
use abortSearch with a clear explanation.

You are encouraged to invoke multiple Workspace tools at once (add summaries, drop fragments, etc).
Do NOT invoke multiple answer/abort actions. Do NOT write code.

toolSpecifications.name: searchSubstrings
toolSpecifications.description:
Returns file names whose text contents match Java regular expression patterns.
This is slower than searchSymbols but can find references to external dependencies and comment strings.

patterns.description: Java-style regex patterns to search for within file contents. Unlike searchSymbols this does not automatically include any implicit anchors or case insensitivity.

reasoning.description: Explanation of what you're looking for in this request so the summarizer can accurately capture it.

toolSpecifications.name: searchFilenames
toolSpecifications.description:
Returns filenames (relative to the project root) that match the given Java regular expression patterns.
Use this to find configuration files, test data, or source files when you know part of their name.

patterns.description: Java-style regex patterns to match against filenames.

reasoning.description: Explanation of what you're looking for in this request so the summarizer can accurately capture it.

toolSpecifications.name: getFileContents
toolSpecifications.description:
Returns the full contents of the specified files. Use this after searchFilenames or searchSubstrings, or when you need the content of a non-code file.
This can be expensive for large files.

filenames.description: List of filenames (relative to project root) to retrieve contents for.

toolSpecifications.name: getFileSummaries
toolSpecifications.description:
Retrieves summaries (fields and method signatures) for all classes defined within specified project files.
Supports glob patterns: '*' matches files in a single directory, '**' matches files recursively.
This is a fast and efficient way to read multiple related files at once.
(But if you don't know where what you want is located, you should use searchSymbols instead.)

filePaths.description: List of file paths relative to the project root. Supports glob patterns (* for single directory, ** for recursive). E.g., ['src/main/java/com/example/util/*.java', 'tests/foo/**.py']

toolSpecifications.name: addFilesToWorkspace
toolSpecifications.description: Edit project files to the Workspace. Use this when Code Agent will need to make changes to these files, or if you need to read the full source. Only call when you have identified specific filenames. DO NOT call this to create new files -- Code Agent can do that without extra steps.

relativePaths.description: List of file paths relative to the project root (e.g., 'src/main/java/com/example/MyClass.java'). Must not be empty.

toolSpecifications.name: addClassesToWorkspace
toolSpecifications.description: Add classes to the Workspace by their fully qualified names. This maps class names to their containing files and adds those files for editing. Only call when you have identified specific class names.")

classNames.description: List of fully qualified class names (e.g., ['com.example.MyClass', 'org.another.Util']). Must not be empty.

toolSpecifications.name: addClassSummariesToWorkspace
toolSpecifications.description:
Retrieves summaries (fields and method signatures) for specified classes and adds them to the Workspace.
Faster and more efficient than reading entire files or classes when you just need the API and not the full source code.
Only call when you have identified specific class names.")

classNames.description: List of fully qualified class names (e.g., ['com.example.ClassA', 'org.another.ClassB']) to get summaries for. Must not be empty.

toolSpecifications.name: addMethodSourcesToWorkspace
toolSpecifications.description:
Retrieves the full source code of specific methods and adds to the Workspace each as a separate read-only text fragment.
Faster and more efficient than including entire files or classes when you only need a few methods.

methodNames.description: List of fully qualified method names (e.g., ['com.example.ClassA.method1', 'org.another.ClassB.processData']) to retrieve sources for. Must not be empty.

toolSpecifications.name: addFileSummariesToWorkspace
toolSpecifications.description:
Retrieves summaries (fields and method signatures) for all classes defined within specified project files and adds them to the Workspace.
Supports glob patterns: '*' matches files in a single directory, '**' matches files recursively.
Faster and more efficient than reading entire files when you just need the API definitions.
(But if you don't know where what you want is located, you should use Search Agent instead.)

filePaths.description: List of file paths relative to the project root. Supports glob patterns (* for single directory, ** for recursive). E.g., ['src/main/java/com/example/util/*.java', 'tests/foo/**.py']. Must not be empty.

toolSpecifications.name: addSymbolUsagesToWorkspace
toolSpecifications.description: Finds usages of a specific symbol (class, method, field) and adds the full source of the calling methods to the Workspace. Only call when you have identified specific symbols.")

symbol.description: Fully qualified symbol name (e.g., 'com.example.MyClass', 'com.example.MyClass.myMethod', 'com.example.MyClass.myField') to find usages for.

toolSpecifications.name: addCallGraphInToWorkspace
toolSpecifications.description:
Generates a call graph showing methods that call the specified target method (callers) up to a certain depth, and adds it to the Workspace.
The single line of the call sites (but not full method sources) are included

methodName.description: Fully qualified target method name (e.g., 'com.example.MyClass.targetMethod') to find callers for.

depth.description: Maximum depth of the call graph to retrieve (e.g., 3 or 5). Higher depths can be large.

toolSpecifications.name: addCallGraphOutToWorkspace
toolSpecifications.description:
Generates a call graph showing methods called by the specified source method (callees) up to a certain depth, and adds it to the workspace
The single line of the call sites (but not full method sources) are included

methodName.description: Fully qualified source method name (e.g., 'com.example.MyClass.sourceMethod') to find callees for.

depth.description: Maximum depth of the call graph to retrieve (e.g., 3 or 5). Higher depths can be large.

toolSpecifications.name: addTextToWorkspace
toolSpecifications.description: Add an arbitrary block of text (e.g., notes that are independent of the Plan, a configuration snippet, or something learned from another Agent) to the Workspace as a read-only fragment

content.description: The text content to add to the Workspace

description.description: A short, descriptive label for this text fragment (e.g., 'User Requirements', 'API Key Snippet')

toolSpecifications.name: dropWorkspaceFragments
toolSpecifications.description: Remove specified fragments (files, text snippets, task history, analysis results) from the Workspace using their unique string IDs

fragmentIds.description: List of string IDs corresponding to the fragments visible in the workspace that you want to remove. Must not be empty.

toolSpecifications.name: getFiles
toolSpecifications.description: Returns the file paths relative to the project root for the given fully-qualified class names.

classNames.description: List of fully qualified class names (e.g., ['com.example.MyClass', 'org.another.Util']). Must not be empty.

toolSpecifications.name: answerSearch
toolSpecifications.description: Provide a final answer to the user's question or goal. Use this when you have enough information.

explanation.description: Comprehensive explanation that answers the query. Include relevant code snippets and how they relate, formatted in Markdown.

classNames.description: List of fully qualified class names (FQCNs) relevant to the explanation (exhaustive).

toolSpecifications.name: abortSearch
toolSpecifications.description: Abort when you determine the question is not answerable from this codebase or is out of scope.

explanation.description: Clear explanation of why the question cannot be answered from this codebase.
